intro: Dianthus balbisii var. medius, commonly known as the Middle Eastern carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, pink to red flowers with a distinctive, frilled appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from spring to early autumn.
